Package net.farlands.sanctuary.util

Class Range<T extends Comparable<T>>

java.lang.Object
net.farlands.sanctuary.util.Range<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type which is compared. This can be anything that implements Comparable<T extends Comparable<T>>
public class Range<T extends Comparable<T>> extends Object
This is a realively simple class that aids in checking range bounds and offers a useful parser for "Rust-style" range bounds.

      Parameters:
      low - The low bound of the range
      high - The high bound of the range
      inclLow - Whether the low bound is inclusive
      inclHigh - Whether the high bound is inclusive

  • Method Details

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T n)
      Checks if the item is contained within the range
      Parameters:
      n - The item to check
      Returns:
      If the item was within the range

    • from

      public static Range<Integer> from(String rangeStr) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Parse a "Rust-style" range string into a Range<Integer>, like the following:
      • a..b
      • a..=b
      • a..
      • ..b
      • ..=b
      • ..

      Range details:

      • The lower bound, if provided, is included in the comparison
      • The upper bound, by default is not included, but providing = includes it
      Parameters:
      rangeStr - The string to be parsed into the Range
      Returns:
      The range that has been parsed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When rangeStr is not a valid range string

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Convert to a string

      If Range is of type Integer and Integer.class was passed to the constructor, it will show using the "rust-style" notation, otherwise it will use interval notation.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
